content: 1. Which of the following is the best description of the management concept?

answers.text: a) a simple organization that does tasks.
b) The systematic planning and control of companies to achieve their goals.
c) the management of resources by a single person.
d) a method to motivate employees.

content: 2. Which of the following statements best meets the importance of "efficiency" in management?

answers.text: a) Efficiency is only important if it increases profitability.
b) Efficiency is a central goal that maximizes productivity and resource use.
c) Efficiency is only relevant for small companies.
d) Efficiency is a question of personal preferences.

content: 3. Which of the following statements best describes the role of "organization" in management?

answers.text: a) The organization is only a tool for achieving goals.
b) The organization is a system that defines tasks and responsibilities and promotes cooperation between different departments.
c) The organization is only an organizational structure.
d) The organization is a single person.

content: 4. How does the "corporate center" strategy affect decision -making in management?

answers.text: a) It leads to uncritical decision -making.
b) It is a central part of strategic planning and decision -making.
c) It is only based on the opinion of the employees.
d) It is irrelevant for corporate management.

content: 5. Which of the following statements is the main goal of management in a company?

answers.text: a) The achievement of profits for shareholders.
b) the fulfillment of the needs of customers.
c) The optimization of resource use.
d) the creation of a large and complex organization.

content: 6. Which of the following statements is most relevant for employee motivation?

answers.text: a) Employees are only motivated if they receive high salaries.
b) Employees are motivated if they have a high workload.
c) Employees are motivated if they can participate in the corporate goals and goals.
d) Employees are only motivated if they are interested in their own tasks.

content: 7. What is an important aspect of the "internal and external networks" in corporate management?

answers.text: a) The reduction of internal communication.
b) The strengthening of relationships with external partners and customers.
c) the isolation from the outside world.
d) Ignoring the needs of customers.

content: 8. Which of the following statements describes the fundamental importance of "informal coordination"?

answers.text: a) Informal coordination is only relevant for small companies.
b) Informal coordination is important to improve cooperation and increase efficiency.
c) Informal coordination is irrelevant for corporate management.
d) Informal coordination is only for the manager.

content: 9. Which of the following statements is the biggest difference between "informal" and "formally" coordination?

answers.text: a) Informal coordination is always formal.
b) Informal coordination is uncomplicated, while formally coordination is complex.
c) Formal coordination is always uncomplicated, while informal coordination is complex.
d) Informal coordination is always complex, while formally coordination is simple.

content: 10. Which of the following statements is most relevant for strategic planning in a company?

answers.text: a) The company only focuses on short -term profitability.
b) The company looks at the long -term goals and the strategic orientation.
c) The company ignores the needs of customers.
d) The company is only focused on the internal organization.

content: 11. What is the main purpose of the "procedures" in management?

answers.text: a) the achievement of new products.
b) The improvement of the work processes and the standardization of processes.
c) Avoiding errors.
d) the increase in costs.

content: 12. Which of the following statements best describes the role of the "organizational structure"?

answers.text: a) The organizational structure is just a document.
b) The organizational structure is a system that defines the tasks and responsibilities and promotes cooperation between different departments.
c) The organizational structure is a personal project.
d) The organizational structure is independent of the corporate strategy.

content: 13. Which of the following statements does the main objective of the "guaranteed control" represent?

answers.text: a) the achievement of profit.
b) the ensure that the company's processes and activities work properly.
c) the reduction of the costs.
d) Avoidance of risks.

content: 14. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of the "mechanistic" coordination?

answers.text: a) Mechanistic coordination is only relevant for small companies.
b) Mechanistic coordination is important to improve efficiency and performance.
c) Mechanistic coordination is irrelevant for corporate management.
d) Mechanistic coordination is only for the manager.

content: 15. What is the main goal of the "individual selections"?

answers.text: a) The achievement of profits for shareholders.
b) the achievement of opportunities for the employees.
c) improving working conditions.
d) the reduction of the costs.
